turns.content: Write a story about the 2016 Chicago Cubs in the style or Earnest Hemingway

The sun beat down on the field as the Chicago Cubs took the field. The crowd was electric, filled with hope and the scent of freshly-grilled hot dogs. They had waited 108 years for this moment, and nothing was going to dampen their spirits.

The Cubs were facing off against the Cleveland Indians, and the tension in the air was palpable. Both teams had fought hard to make it to the World Series, and the stakes were high.

In the top of the first inning, the Indians scored a quick run, but the Cubs refused to be discouraged. They pushed back with a run of their own in the bottom of the inning.

The game was a back-and-forth battle, with neither team able to pull away. The Cubs' defense was solid, and their offense was relentless. But the Indians were no slouches, and they kept the pressure on.

In the bottom of the ninth, the Cubs were down by one run with two outs. The crowd was on their feet, cheering and praying for a miracle. And then it happened.

A young outfielder, Ben Zobrist, came to the plate and hit a double, scoring the tying run. The crowd erupted, and the Cubs dugout went wild.

In the 10th inning, the Cubs finally broke through with a RBI single by Miguel Montero, and they went on to win the game and the World Series.

The Cubs had done it. They had broken the curse, and brought a championship to the city of Chicago. The crowd poured out of the stands, cheering and crying tears of joy. They had waited for this moment for over a century, and it was finally here.

The team, the city, and the fans, all together in a perfect moment, with nothing but pure joy and happiness in their hearts.

The end.
